author: Renzari
title: Trans. Lt. Blue!!
review:
Im a MOC builder, so this set didn't last long, but I always keep it in tact for a day or two to enjoy LEGO's own creation.

Box/Instructions

The bag had a nice design on it, always enjoy the bag. The instructions were smaller than I expected but wasn't hard to understand.

Parts

The set includes a lot of trans. Lt. Blue parts. Armor, head, even the "bones" were Trans. Lt. Blue! They are really useful pieces, but the other pieces are good too. The most interesting pieces are the Trans. Lt. Blue pieces, the new stud-gun, the green spikes (once only in red), the cocoon, the printed chest piece, and Bulk's helmet.

Minifigures

The Bulk Minifigure uses Silver HF Mini Hero parts! His design fits him but why the rocket boots?

The build

The build want hard at all. The only challenging part will be the adjustment to the Grabbing Staff thing. The build is easy yet fun. Matches the age range nicely.

The completed model

The completed model looks nice. Have a light behind Crystal Beast and he glows! ^_^ A little weird to have the hands the way they are but I like them. Not the best but they did their best.

Overall opinion

This is a 4-5 set to me. The neck is too long. Would've been better with a size 3 Trans. Lt. Blue bone piece (like the legs, arms, tail). The staff is not necessary. Crystal Beast looks more of a beast who would use his clawed hands than a staff. His hands are a little different than I thought, but overall this set is good if you want another enemy in your collection. Again, 4-5 from me. Don't let this review make your opinions change. Get it for yourself and make your own opinions. This set now has one review and Im happy it was me ^_^. Renzari "logging off"
